pros: Extremely breathable; Snappy and speedy ride; Suitable for tempo runs and long distances; Fits wider feet; Secure lockdown; Grippy and durable outsole; Budget friendly for a race-ready shoe at $130
cons: Could be lighter; Not for harsh winter days; Noisy
RR_verdict: The Adizero Adios line may have fallen out of favor since its marathon record-breaking early days, but in our opinion, the Adios 8 is definitely a step in the right direction in bringing the series back into the good graces of performance runners. This shoe delivers an old-school, nimble ride that reminds us of simpler times before the proliferation of carbon-plated super shoes on the starting line.
awards: Top pick in best running shoes with a wide toebox (2023), Top 24% in road running shoes, Top 29% in Adidas running shoes
